s.text: It is important to note that while we have used gene-expression data generated from Affymetrix GeneChips, data from other microarray platforms and other techniques such as SAGE (serial analysis of gene expression) can be used equally easily.
Extreme positive scores suggest GO terms with the greatest confidence that the correlation between the expression changes of the genes in this grouping are not occurring by chance alone.
Extreme positive scores suggest GO terms with the greatest confidence that the correlation between the expression changes of the genes in this grouping are not occurring by chance alone.
Extreme positive scores suggest GO terms with the greatest confidence that the correlation between the expression changes of the genes in this grouping are not occurring by chance alone.
Extreme positive scores suggest GO terms with the greatest confidence that the correlation between the expression changes of the genes in this grouping are not occurring by chance alone.

Identifying those groups of biologically related genes that are showing a large number of gene-expression changes will create an informative description of the biology that is occurring in a particular dataset, making it possible to generate new hypotheses and identify those specific areas of biology that warrant more detailed investigation.

This is done for each specific GO node, and for the cumulative total of the number of genes meeting the criterion in a parent GO term combined with all of its children, giving a complete picture of the number of genes associated with a particular GO term.
Therefore, if two GO terms contain the same number of genes, the term with the greater number of genes meeting the criterion will receive a higher score.

where N is the total number of genes measured, R is the total number of genes meeting the criterion, n is the total number of genes in this specific MAPP, and r is the number of genes meeting the criterion in this specific MAPP.
It is a standardized difference score ( z score) using the expected value and standard deviation of the number of genes meeting the criterion on a GO term under a hypergeometric distribution.

For each of the 11,239 ([ 12]; as of May 6, 2002]) GO biological process, cellular component and molecular function terms, MAPPFinder calculates the percentage of the genes measured that meet a user-defined criterion.

This is done for each specific GO node, and for the cumulative total of the number of genes meeting the criterion in a parent GO term combined with all of its children, giving a complete picture of the number of genes associated with a particular GO term.

Dividing by the standard deviation adjusts for the size of the GO term, ranking a GO term (or MAPP) with a large number of genes meeting the criterion higher than a GO term (or MAPP) with the same percentage of genes changed, but fewer total genes.

Identifying correlated gene-expression changes in an individual pathway is often interesting, but it is necessary to know if the gene-expression changes seen on a particular pathway are unique to this pathway or are occurring in many other pathways.

Identifying correlated gene-expression changes in an individual pathway is often interesting, but it is necessary to know if the gene-expression changes seen on a particular pathway are unique to this pathway or are occurring in many other pathways.

For each of the 11,239 ([ 12]; as of May 6, 2002]) GO biological process, cellular component and molecular function terms, MAPPFinder calculates the percentage of the genes measured that meet a user-defined criterion.
The MAPPFinder browser also provides three search and navigation functions.

By integrating GenMAPP and MAPPFinder, it is possible to seamlessly move from a global gene-expression profile at the level of all biological processes, components and functions to a detailed description of the gene-expression levels for the specific genes involved.
The GO Consortium is creating a defined vocabulary of terms describing the biological processes, cellular components and molecular functions of all genes.
MAPPFinder builds a local copy of the GO hierarchy using the three ontology files (Process, Component and Function) available from GO [ 12].
To determine the overall number of gene-expression changes in each GO term, an additional criterion of a fold change greater than 1.2 or less than -1.
p value of less than 0.05 to define a significant gene-expression increase, and a fold change of less than -1.
In this case we combined a fold change with a statistical filter to determine significance.

As a start in this direction, GenMAPP.org [ 13] has created over 50 MAPPs depicting metabolic pathways, signaling pathways and gene families.
These data compare healthy mouse hearts at different time points during development, using male and female FVB/N mice.
5-day embryonic time point and the control adult mice.

Similarly, the terms 'main pathways of carbohydrate metabolism', 'catabolic carbohydrate metabolism', and 'glycolysis' also appear as downregulated in Table 2. The MAPPFinder browser (Figure 3a) shows that 'glycolysis' is related to 'main pathways of carboyhydrate metabolism' through the hierarchical relationship between these terms.
